question: Will Bluesky have more than 1,400,000 unique posters on March 30, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the gathered evidence, here are the key points relevant to estimating the probability that Bluesky will have more than 1,400,000 unique posters on March 30, 2025:

1. **User Growth**: Bluesky's user base has grown significantly, reaching over 33 million users by March 2025. This is a rapid increase from 13 million users in late October 2024, indicating strong growth momentum.

2. **Daily Active Users and Posters**: As of November 2024, Bluesky had around 3.2 million daily active users in the US and approximately 1.3 million daily unique posters. Given the continued growth in users, it's reasonable to expect that the number of unique posters has also increased.

3. **Engagement and Features**: Bluesky has been actively adding new features and updates to enhance user engagement, such as reply controls, profile search, and trending topics. These efforts are likely to maintain or increase the number of active posters.

4. **Migration from Other Platforms**: The growth of Bluesky is partly fueled by users migrating from other platforms like X (formerly Twitter), suggesting a trend that could continue to drive user and poster growth.

Given these points, it seems highly probable that Bluesky will have more than 1,400,000 unique posters by March 30, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.85

Looking for the latest Bluesky statistics? You’re in the right place.

Bluesky is the app everyone’s talking about right now.

Following a recent surge in user numbers, it’s become one of the fastest-growing social media platforms. This has led many to wonder if Bluesky will finally emerge as a serious competitor to rival platform X (formerly Twitter).

### 1. Bluesky has over 23.2 million total registered users…

At the time of writing, around 23.2 million people have signed up for Bluesky—and that figure is changing rapidly. By the time you read this post, it may be significantly higher.

Bluesky still has a long way to go to catch up to rival platform X, which is the 11th [most-used social media platform](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/) with 619 million users. However, if Bluesky maintains its current momentum, it may begin to close that gap over the next few years.

# Bluesky Statistics – How Many Users Does Bluesky Have?

Bluesky has become one of the fastest-growing social networks since its public launch in February 2024.

Keep reading to see our full list of Bluesky statistics for 2025 including user numbers, downloads, and site traffic.

## Key statistics

- Bluesky has 27.44 million registered users as of January 2025.
- In November 2024, Bluesky saw its highest number of downloads at 7.85 million.
- The U.S. has the highest share of monthly Bluesky site visitors with 42.44% of total visitors, followed by Brazil with 10.28%.
- Users in the UK make up 7.53% of Bluesky traffic.
- The majority (60.45%) of Bluesky users are aged 34 or under, and 61.53% are male.
- It is estimated that there have been over 800 million posts on Bluesky since its launch.
- Bluesky has 20 full-time employees and around 100 external contractors.

## Bluesky overview

| Founder | Jack Dorsey |
| CEO | Jay Graber |
| Public launch | February 2024 |
| Headquarters | Seattle, Washington |
| Registered users | 27.44 million (as of January 2025) |
| Full-time employees | 20 |
| Funding | $23 million |

## Bluesky founders and employees

Bluesky was a research project initially [started in 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluesky) by Jack Dorsey when he was CEO of Twitter, eventually becoming an independent company in 2021. Following Elon Musk’s acquisition of Twitter in 2022, the two companies went their separate ways and Bluesky became available as an invite-only service in February 2023. Dorsey left Bluesky’s board in May 2024.

According to a post by CEO Jay Graber, Bluesky had just [20 full-time employees](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r) as of November 2024, meaning the platform had roughly one million users per employee at the time.

### Jack Dorsey

[Jack Dorsey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Dorsey) is an American businessman, best known as a co-founder of Twitter which he created in March 2006 alongside Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams. # Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has
**27.44 million**users. - In November 2024, monthly installs of Bluesky app reached
**7.85 million**. - In the US and UK, Bluesky app has around
**3.5 million**daily active users. **20**full-time employees work at Bluesky

## Bluesky Registered Users

According to the latest update, Bluesky currently has **27.44 million** registered users.

Bluesky crossed the milestone of 20 million users in November 2024.

Here’s a table with number of Bluesky users over time:

| Date | Bluesky Registered Users |
|---|---|
| September 15, 204 | 10 million |
| October 19, 2024 | 12.11 million |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 19, 2024 | 25.9 million |
| January 4, 2025 | 26.31 million |
| January 14, 2025 | 27.44 million |

**Sources:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eaura22r), [Jaz’s Bsky Stats](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/16/bluesky-now-has-10-million-users/)

## Bluesky Downloads

Monthly downloads of Bluesky on Google Play and App Store combined were **1.76 million** in December 2024.

As of November, annual downloads worldwide of Bluesky in 2024 amounted to 16.52 million.

Here’s a table with monthly downloads of Bluesky app worldwide across Google Play and App Store combined:

| Date | Bluesky Downloads |
|---|---|
| February 2023 | 0.02 million |
| March 2023 | 0.09 million |
| April 2023 | 0.58 million |
| May 2023 | 0.25 million |
| June 2023 | 0.09 million |
| July 20…

# Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)

Looking for the latest Bluesky statistics? You’re in the right place.

Bluesky is the app everyone’s talking about right now.

Following a recent surge in user numbers, it’s become one of the fastest-growing social media platforms. This has led many to wonder if Bluesky will finally emerge as a serious competitor to rival platform X (formerly Twitter).

In this post, I’ll be sharing 27 stats that reveal more about Bluesky’s meteoric growth, its user demographics, and other interesting insights.

## Top picks

- Bluesky has 23.2 million total users and 3.2 million daily active users (Theo.io, Similarweb3)
- Users visit the Bluesky website 75.8 million times monthly… (Similarweb)
- …and download the Bluesky app 400k times daily (Appfigures)
- Bluesky users have shared over 658 million posts in total (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky users have followed accounts 1.1 billion times and liked posts 1.1 billion times (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky (@bsky.app) is the most-followed account on the platform (VQV.APP)
- Most Bluesky users are from Brazil (37.7%), the US (25.6%), and Japan (8.7%) (Similarweb, Bluesky1)

## Bluesky user statistics

First, let’s look at statistics that highlight how many people currently use Bluesky, how those numbers have changed over time, and the factors that are driving its growth.

### 1. Bluesky has over 23.2 million total registered users…

At the time of writing, around 23.2 million people have signed up for Bluesky—and that figure is changing rapidly. By the time you read this post, it may be significantly higher.

Bluesky still has a long way to go to catch up to rival platform X, which is the 11th [most-used social media platform](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/) with 619 million users. However, if Bluesky maintains its current momentum, it may begin to close that gap over the next few years.

Source: Theo.io

### 2. …that’s up from just 1 million users last year…

# Bluesky Statistics – How Many Users Does Bluesky Have?

Bluesky has become one of the fastest-growing social networks since its public launch in February 2024.

Keep reading to see our full list of Bluesky statistics for 2025 including user numbers, downloads, and site traffic.

## Key statistics

- Bluesky has 27.44 million registered users as of January 2025.
- In November 2024, Bluesky saw its highest number of downloads at 7.85 million.
- The U.S. has the highest share of monthly Bluesky site visitors with 42.44% of total visitors, followed by Brazil with 10.28%.
- Users in the UK make up 7.53% of Bluesky traffic.
- The majority (60.45%) of Bluesky users are aged 34 or under, and 61.53% are male.
- It is estimated that there have been over 800 million posts on Bluesky since its launch.
- Bluesky has 20 full-time employees and around 100 external contractors.

## Bluesky overview

| Founder | Jack Dorsey |
| CEO | Jay Graber |
| Public launch | February 2024 |
| Headquarters | Seattle, Washington |
| Registered users | 27.44 million (as of January 2025) |
| Full-time employees | 20 |
| Funding | $23 million |

## Bluesky founders and employees

Bluesky was a research project initially [started in 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluesky) by Jack Dorsey when he was CEO of Twitter, eventually becoming an independent company in 2021. Following Elon Musk’s acquisition of Twitter in 2022, the two companies went their separate ways and Bluesky became available as an invite-only service in February 2023. Dorsey left Bluesky’s board in May 2024.

According to a post by CEO Jay Graber, Bluesky had just [20 full-time employees](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r) as of November 2024, meaning the platform had roughly one million users per employee at the time.

### Jack Dorsey

[Jack Dorsey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Dorsey) is an American businessman, best known as a co-founder of Twitter which he created in March 2006 alongside Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams. Dorsey became CEO of Twitter in 2015 and remained until 2021 when he announced his resignation. He left t…

Dorsey left Bluesky’s board in May 2024.

According to a post by CEO Jay Graber, Bluesky had just [20 full-time employees](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r) as of November 2024, meaning the platform had roughly one million users per employee at the time.

### Jack Dorsey

[Jack Dorsey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Dorsey) is an American businessman, best known as a co-founder of Twitter which he created in March 2006 alongside Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams. Dorsey became CEO of Twitter in 2015 and remained until 2021 when he announced his resignation. He left t…

# Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has

# Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)

Looking for the latest Bluesky statistics? You’re in the right place.

Bluesky is the app everyone’s talking about right now.

Following a recent surge in user numbers, it’s become one of the fastest-growing social media platforms. This has led many to wonder if Bluesky will finally emerge as a serious competitor to rival platform X (formerly Twitter).

In this post, I’ll be sharing 27 stats that reveal more about Bluesky’s meteoric growth, its user demographics, and other interesting insights.

At the time of writing, around 23.2 million people have signed up for Bluesky—and that figure is changing rapidly. By the time you read this post, it may be significantly higher.

Bluesky still has a long way to go to catch up to rival platform X, which is the 11th [most-used social media platform](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/) with 619 million users. However, if Bluesky maintains its current momentum, it may begin to close that gap over the next few years.

# Bluesky Statistics – How Many Users Does Bluesky Have?

Bluesky has become one of the fastest-growing social networks since its public launch in February 2024.

Keep reading to see our full list of Bluesky statistics for 2025 including user numbers, downloads, and site traffic.

## Key statistics

- Bluesky has 27.44 million registered users as of January 2025.
- In November 2024, Bluesky saw its highest number of downloads at 7.85 million.
- The U.S. has the highest share of monthly Bluesky site visitors with 42.44% of total visitors, followed by Brazil with 10.28%.
- Users in the UK make up 7.53% of Bluesky traffic.
- The majority (60.45%) of Bluesky users are aged 34 or under, and 61.53% are male.
- It is estimated that there have been over 800 million posts on Bluesky since its launch.
- Bluesky has 20 full-time employees and around 100 external contractors.

## Bluesky overview

| Founder | Jack Dorsey |
| CEO | Jay Graber |
| Public launch | February 2024 |
| Headquarters | Seattle, Washington |
| Registered users | 27.44 million (as of January 2025) |
| Full-time employees | 20 |
| Funding | $23 million |

## Bluesky founders and employees

Bluesky was a research project initially [started in 2019](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluesky) by Jack Dorsey when he was CEO of Twitter, eventually becoming an independent company in 2021. Following Elon Musk’s acquisition of Twitter in 2022, the two companies went their separate ways and Bluesky became available as an invite-only service in February 2023. Dorsey left Bluesky’s board in May 2024.

According to a post by CEO Jay Graber, Bluesky had just [20 full-time employees](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r) as of November 2024, meaning the platform had roughly one million users per employee at the time.

### Jack Dorsey

[Jack Dorsey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Dorsey) is an American businessman, best known as a co-founder of Twitter which he created in March 2006 alongside Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams. Based on the gathered evidence, here are the key points relevant to estimating the probability that Bluesky will have more than 1,400,000 unique posters on March 30, 2025:

1. **User Growth**: Bluesky's user base has grown significantly, reaching over 33 million users by March 2025. This is a rapid increase from 13 million users in late October 2024, indicating strong growth momentum.

2. **Daily Active Users and Posters**: As of November 2024, Bluesky had around 3.2 million daily active users in the US and approximately 1.3 million daily unique posters. Given the continued growth in users, it's reasonable to expect that the number of unique posters has also increased.

3. **Engagement and Features**: Bluesky has been actively adding new features and updates to enhance user engagement, such as reply controls, profile search, and trending topics. These efforts are likely to maintain or increase the number of active posters.

4. **Migration from Other Platforms**: The growth of Bluesky is partly fueled by users migrating from other platforms like X (formerly Twitter), suggesting a trend that could continue to drive user and poster growth.

Given these points, it seems highly probable that Bluesky will have more than 1,400,000 unique posters by March 30, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.85
